idea-plugin.name: XRefactoring
idea-plugin.description:
XRefactoring

XRefactoring is a plugin that helps you refactor your code by replacing magic numbers with named constants,... (there are more to come) Magic numbers are literal values that appear directly in the code, such as 3.14, 42, or 100. They can make the code hard to read, understand, and maintain, as they often have no clear meaning or purpose. By extracting magic numbers into named constants, you can improve the readability, clarity, and quality of your code.

With this plugin, you can:

  • Extract magic numbers into constants using a refactoring action. The plugin will replace all occurrences of the magic numbers with the constants. This will be very helpful when there are a lot of magic numbers to be extracted.

XRefactoring is a useful plugin for developers who want to follow the best practices of clean code and avoid using magic numbers in their code. You can download and install the plugin from the JetBrains Marketplace or the GitHub repository
